intro: Cineraria serrata, commonly known as the serrated cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and vibrant blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking appearance. Cineraria serrata is also valued for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
